alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 6:57PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gloucester, Middlesex, east central King and Queen, southeastern Northumberland, southeastern Richmond, Mathews, Lancaster and southeastern Essex Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 657 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Church View, or near Urbanna, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mathews, Gloucester Courthouse, Kilmarnock, Urbanna, Deltaville, Robley, Lancaster, White Stone, Hayes, Morattico, Saluda, Jamaica, Gwynn, Church View, Sharps, Hartfield, Glenns, Blakes, Little Plymouth and Shacklefords. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Lancaster; Mathews; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond
